title: Cognitive Load Management Strategies for Self-Directed Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Graduate-level foundational knowledge in social sciences and online learning experience
context.additional_context: Learners primarily use smartphones as learning tools, with limitations in adapting to complex digital environments; instructors provide personalized feedback through real-time interaction.

learning_goals: Learners can apply a framework for analyzing cognitive load with 80% accuracy in self-directed learning processes.
Learners implement at least three strategies to regulate extraneous/intrinsic cognitive load during task performance-assessment-selection stages.
Learners can increase germane cognitive load by over 50% using variability principles and self-explanation techniques when learning advanced social science topics.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
